alert.note: Alert for Coastal Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 12:20PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Broward County, Coastal Miami Dade County, Coastal Palm Beach County, Metro Broward County, Metro Palm Beach County and Metropolitan Miami Dade. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous slow moving showers and thunderstorms are expected this afternoon through early this evening. 1-3 inches of rain is expected in locations where heavy rain occurs, with isolated amounts of 5 inches or more possible. Some locations are already saturated from previous rainfall earlier this week, so additional heavy rain will further add to flooding concerns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
